Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The WF3 types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new WF4 types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Defines the behavior for the associated with a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WorkflowRuntimeBehavior> to access the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> object in your workflow service. The <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> object is added by default when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WorkflowServiceHost> is created.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WorkflowRuntimeBehavior.CachedInstanceExpiration%2A> property to 10 minutes.

Docs.summary: Configures the workflow service to support the workflow run-time behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method creates a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WorkflowRuntimeBehavior.CachedInstanceExpiration%2A> extension and configures it for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how long a workflow instance stays in-memory in the idle state before it is forcibly removed from memory.
Docs.value: A object indicating how long a workflow instance stays in-memory in the idle state before it is forcibly removed from memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> object is not initialized before retrieving this property, then a new <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> object is created.
